author: {'steamid': '76561198384521168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1046, 'last_played': 1585274625}
review:
标准的视觉小说，描述真正意义上治愈(recuperation)的故事。
试想一下寻求治愈的人需要什么，那便是此小说所竭力呈现的环境与内容。这里没有波澜壮阔的背景，也没有突兀煽情的转折，更没有生离死别的苦楚。有的只是宁静与祥和，以及不断反思的内心，正如标题seabed所传达的一样，渐渐沉入海底的感觉。
剧情而言，所谓结局与真相，在序章就已经阐明了。但要了解整个世界观和小说想要传达的内容，则需要看至终章，甚至带着“上帝视角”再看一次。核心思想与主题大抵是开放性的，主线外也夹杂很多小情节，不同角度能得出不同内容与情感。这个从其他玩家的评论当中也能看出来，原剧本的深度与价值可见一斑。[spoiler]我个人是从日记最后的“对不起”解读的 [/spoiler]

横向比较的话，我认为此作堪比同人巅峰的海市蜃楼之馆，甚至剧本更出色。（馆有不少生硬的地方）但终究这个作品成为了遗珠，可能与cg风格的不恰当以及错误的商业侵蚀有关，颇为可惜。

author: {'steamid': '76561198952122872', 'num_games_owned': 32, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1432, 'last_played': 1585407771}

author: {'steamid': '76561198829674873', 'num_games_owned': 520, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 1310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1310, 'last_played': 1584977937}
review:
佐知子终究会来的。
到那个时候，我一定会准备好的。
毕竟，她做的这些，都是为了我。

SeaBed是一款非常慢热的视觉“小说”，它不同于其他gal，没有各种现在流行的萌元素，但有属于它自己的叙事风格，很多bgm都让我感到放松，环境描写和内心情感都十分丰富，日常描写也非常用心，让我觉得这就是一本文艺小说。通过佐知子和贵呼的视角切换中讲述了一个互相渴望再见的故事。
序章的漫长、叙事的混乱、大量让人摸不着头脑的[spoiler] 百合 [/spoiler]日常应该是劝退大部分人的主要因素，通过steam的成就完成情况就可以感受到——只有大概四分之一的人过了序章，但18%左右的玩家通关了本作。这看得出来序章真的是炼金石，能坚持到这，基本上都能坚持到结束，见证整个故事的结局。
我花了20小时左右打完了本作，推的算挺快的了，但序章好像花了4个小时，我还以为后面的章节都是这么长，吓死我了。[spoiler] 这真的不是故意的吗？后面章节都相对短不少，最后面几章更短 [/spoiler]本作含有不少心理学知识，特别是精神分析流派心理治疗[spoiler]在我看来，seabed象征着潜意识 [/spoiler]，我有这方面基础，所以猜到不少剧情内容[spoiler]但没看懂结局 [/spoiler]。剧情颇有意识流的感觉，叙事颇为跳跃，加上本作并没有语音，所以一些内容挺难理解的，适合二周目再次寻找前面的线索。
在最后的电话中，她们没有询问对方过多，只是一起回忆过去的点点滴滴，因为她们终信最后一定会相见的。

author: {'steamid': '76561198451225001', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1999, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1647183808}
review: 呃...看了3个小时了还没看完序章呢，然后剧情挺厉害的虽然我现在有点懵逼但是这个剧情真的是有往下看越有意思！！！好吧经过一段漫长的时间我玩完了，哎呀好压抑啊不过我相信结局算是好的，或许在现实中新的开始或许也不差，这个看起来并没有那么无聊剧情还是很棒的，内心的世界描述的非常好，虽然有些没玩懂但是这部游戏在我的内心深深留下了印记，我很喜欢这部游戏不仅给我带来痛苦带来了压抑带来了致郁让我哭了一场，但是玩完结局后回忆起她们之间的爱我内心温暖的哭了！

author: {'steamid': '76561198125083227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 914, 'last_played': 1674745732}
review: 本人词穷，想不出来如何夸这篇作品。

author: {'steamid': '76561198343183000', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2002, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1844, 'last_played': 1620038360}
review:
[spoiler]  一个为了让她活下去而慢慢死去的世界……   [/spoiler]
非常凄美的故事，需要耐心才能读完，本阅读障碍读完全篇用了30个小时，序章就用了我四个小时。
前几章氛围还算轻松[spoiler]  不过由于序章就告诉了你两人的结局，所以这些很甜的回忆实际上是玻璃渣跟糖混在一起的   [/spoiler]，中期开始慢慢回收伏笔，氛围也开始变得压抑，很多时候就算猜到剧情也还是会被带动情绪。
剧情上集中的感情爆发点比较少，但是很多片段在某个瞬间回忆起来又会让人潸然泪下。
我想把她推荐给所有百合爱好者[spoiler]  不能只有我一个人被虐   [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198325435375', 'num_games_owned': 454, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1159, 'last_played': 1587175513}
review:
seabed真的是一个有点反互联网的小众艺术品，游戏全程无cv，立绘也少的可怜，cg姑且还说得过去，我感觉制作层面上的亮点仅有音效和bgm。但是这部视觉小说真正强大的是语言部分，它的语言很细致，有大量过于充满生活感的动作描写以及细节描写，并且内容上的叙述详略得当，把握非常好。整个剧情的结构很完整，但是叙事方式采用了三视角来写，又加之语言问题，我之前推英文版已经有一段时间，确实是很乏力，这里要感谢汉化组的无私奉献，能使我这两天通畅地享受这个游戏。
seabed的故事是缺乏正反馈的，整个游戏过程既是在隐隐作痛中回忆美好往事，又不断地逼近故事真相，顺便把世界观隐晦地阐述出来，直至最终，这个过程我都感觉是压抑的，是伤感的。我尽力理解整个游戏的设定，机制，一周目完成后最重要最关键的一些机理如果你观察或是思考仔细是比较容易发觉的，但是对于一些细枝末节的部分故事的留白很严重，我也没有给自己一个特别满意的猜测，这就需要以后海学家们(如果有的话)来研究，来提出假设了。
seabed真的是一个需要令人慢慢品味的好游戏，在大家对于VN类的游戏的理解越来越肤浅，越来越偏颇乃至越来越低俗的时候，我们真的应该珍视这种纯粹的艺术品。

author: {'steamid': '76561198097421697', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1011, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1011, 'last_played': 1584600581}
review: 剧本是好，剧情不喜欢，通篇充斥着绝望的孤独的感觉，再给我一次机会我肯定选择不会碰这游戏

author: {'steamid': '76561198294766266', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1721, 'last_played': 1672494727}
review:
可以说seabed并不是所有玩家都会喜欢的文字游戏，它没有市面上容易炒热气氛的各种萌元素，cg也算得上简陋的，大量的文字描写，乱序以及分不清现实幻想的第一人称，游玩四小时后也不一定能将序章读完，在故事开始前[spoiler] 是的，阅读慢的话四个小时都不会正式开始 [/spoiler]玩家可能会先失去耐心。
没游玩之前如果你是片羽、银河铁道之夜这类型作品粉丝的话，个人想推荐你试试这作，没自信你会百分百喜欢，能尝试一下我认为是件不吃亏的事。
该作有着大量的对话以及各种心理描写，平铺直叙的手法也不一定能清楚主视觉角色目前状况，三位主人公两位记忆与精神方面出现了某种障碍，第一人称还会带偏读者分不清现实与幻觉的交点，前中期和雾里看花一样。不过这些并不会影响玩家观感，登场人物都是性格温和好相处的人，伴随音乐一起走进她们的内心就好，边做笔记边玩，一路下来也记了好几张，有些地方想二周目看看，这游戏也值得。
词穷说不出好话，最后说下这并不是一部让人心情愉快也不想单纯归类到虐系的游戏吧（仅个人观点）
下面是游戏中让我释然的一句话
[spoiler]佐知子终究会来的，到那个时候，我一定会准备好的。毕竟，她做的这些，都是为了我  [/spoiler]
我承认，你们是最佳拍档

author: {'steamid': '76561198366908773', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1191, 'last_played': 1604725791}

author: {'steamid': '76561198214156215', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 432, 'last_played': 1584710087}
review:
看到有汉化就冲进来玩了，说实话我这类游戏玩得少，完整打通过的就FSN和石头门+石头门0，Seabed给我的感受应该说是和那3个作品完全不同，还没打通，但是我真的很想把它推荐给身边所有的姬佬，感觉takako和satiko的默契真的好棒啊，所以失去时非常感同身受。虽然立绘和音乐都透露着贫穷的气息，但这并不影响我们欣赏这部作品好的地方。不说了我接着看了。顺便一提，我最喜欢的角色是医生，无论是人设还是台词，都帅爆了。
看完了，真的要再次感谢汉化组，让我有机会欣赏到这一部精彩作品。
[spoiler] 到最后，关于佐知子和贵呼，其实我倒是释怀了，期待佐知子和老板娘能有进一步发展，应该会很有趣，但是关于医生，我更加意难平了，虽然她只是一个玩偶，我真的好喜欢她  [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198388359394', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 922, 'last_played': 1692542639}
review: 与其说是gal不如说是一部长篇小说，一路下了都是密密的文字，但是却并不枯燥，游戏的音乐真的棒到了极点，给人的感觉是一种惬意的享受，如果你有空闲的时间不妨静下心来细细的品位这个动人心弦的故事，故事还是有点复杂，我是一路下来都在记笔记，通关之后，佐知子和贵呼的点点滴滴都缠绕在我心头，令我不禁潸然泪下，玩到最后我哭了，这是一个伤感的故事，但最后却莫名的温暖了起来，现在我只想说，我特么吹爆这个故事！！！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198347415154', 'num_games_owned': 1544, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1170, 'last_played': 1584367755}
review: 玩这部游戏需要相当的耐心，全篇下来情节上基本不会有太大的起伏，七八成的文字都是对话，状态不好的话，可能会看睡着。游戏的画面和系统非常简陋，真“视觉小说”。故事的整体构思算是挺有趣的了，双线剧情，三人视角，场景一直在两边来回切换，加上一堆伏笔，游戏前期有点看不懂，中后期知道真相以后也感觉有些地方有逻辑漏洞，一直到通关，对于部分设定还是一脸懵逼。

author: {'steamid': '76561198065236761', 'num_games_owned': 966, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 7800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7798, 'last_played': 1586783420}
review:
[h1] seabed/海底已有汉化	[/h1]
https://keylol.com/t570879-1-1
海底世界是那么黑暗，深邃，让人窒息，但当阳光透过海面照亮所有世界时，童年的美好不会消散，最爱的恋人仍将旅行，新的故事将继续编织。三千世界的悲伤，救赎，怀念浑然一体，非常精彩。
番组计划评分：8.4/10
VNDB评分：8.08/10
个人评分：9.4/10
本作我完全不想剧透，参与汉化也是想将如此优秀的作品传递给大家，整个故事偏以景抒情，节奏很缓有点考人耐心，但打通后的释然让我觉得海底是我目前玩到过的最触动我的百合作，她的救赎和她的悲伤，还有未来那无限的美好，让我深深爱上了这款游戏，如果读者你也是百合游戏爱好者或对剧情看重的VN爱好者，此作定不可错过。

author: {'steamid': '76561198004885007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 920, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 920, 'last_played': 1583810869}
review:
I'm giving up on SeaBed after finishing Chapter 3. That's around 15 hours at my likely slow reading speed.

I don't recall minding Tolkien's meandering descriptive passages and exposition on supporting characters when first reading The Lord of the Rings, and yet I cannot fathom what purpose over half of SeaBed's passages serve, if not incessantly prolonging the actual development of the narrative in order to create some illusory impression of deep, meaningful writing. While a small handful of details give the reader subtle clues that something is amiss, the majority of visual description is either contradicted or made redundant by the accompanying on-screen images. Why, then, is this a *visual* novel to begin with? Somehow it reminds me of how many JRPGS revel in repetitive look-alike battling for seemingly no other reason than to appease some arbitrary genre expectation of how many hours such games should last.

Likewise, while some of the dialogue provides insight into characters' personalities and philosophies, I found the majority of it to be redundant and mundane. I've lost count of the number of times two characters engaged in some drawn-out, inane conversation seemingly only to conceal one or two individual details (at most!) that hint at a larger mystery. I wouldn't consider myself to be someone who can't handle a slow-paced, character-focused story- for instance, I would probably consider Marimite one of my favorite anime series- but SeaBed needlessly delays relevant progression of its core idea too often, for too long, and for too little gain.

While it's theoretically possible that reading the rest of the story would put everything into proper context and make me reverse a lot of my opinions, realistically I'd say that's highly unlikely. For me personally, this is simply poor writing. Or, phrased more diplomatically, it's a style of writing that simply does not hold enough appeal for me.
developer_response:
Thanks for the checking out SeaBed and sticking with it that far.

Sorry to hear the narrative wasn't to your liking. The chapters get shorter toward the end so you are actually quite far already.

"Everything happens for a reason" is also true for practically any passage in this story. That said, one of the fans made the observation that you're significantly more likely to enjoy SeaBed if you're a fan of at least 2 of these genres:

-Yuri
-Slice of life
-Mystery

That's why it's completely understandable that it's not to everyone's liking, and we try to emphasize these elements in promoting it. 

We heartily recommend anyone to check out the free demo which gives a very representative idea of the style of the game and whether you'll like it or not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198300294811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3801, 'last_played': 1637133028}
review:
[h1]Not many Visual Novels on the English market nowadays have superb writing as with what SeaBed offers.[/h1] 

Maybe that is perhaps because that SeaBed is less of a visual novel and more like a fantastic piece of literature (with music and pictures... but, like, not like a visual novel). Why is this so? There is definitely more behind the narrative than other visual novels (and especially with the limited selection of yuri visual novels offered on Steam). Although I would like to explain further on why SeaBed's plot is so much different compared to other visual novels, there is little that can be said without spoiling the richness of the story that is to be uncovered.

What I can say is, however, is that you should expect to be completely confused during the story and [b]after[/b] finishing the story. The story is also linear, meaning of course only one ending and with that one ending is where all of the writing is dedicated to.

To be stressed once again, this visual novel reads more akin to a book than that of a traditional visual novel most people are familiar with. [b]There will not be a lot of anime-like antics[/b]. There will be excessive details on little things that would bore the normal anime-watcher/VN player. If you do not prefer reading traditional, paper-bound novels often, then chances are you may not get very far into the text without sheer determination to make the most of your money spent on this title. [b]After all, reading this novel is the estimated equivalence of reading a 700 page novel (like Harry Potter!).[/b] [u]Expect a gameplay length of roughly twenty hours.[/u]

[i]As a reference, the Achievements Page shows that out of all the buyers of this game (including bundles), only roughly 25% of players got past the Prologue.[/i] [b]The Prologue. Only 25% finished it.[/b]

[h1]If you can handle the hard labor of getting through a lengthy book simply for a grand ol' time, look no further than to SeaBed. It will not disappoint the dedicated.[/h1]

[i]P.S: It has yuri. Good yuri.[/i] [spoiler]The lovers are also actual adults, mind you.[/spoiler]

review: 스포일러 없이 말하기 힘들지만, 슬프면서도, 너무나 아름다운, 사랑 이야기였다. 게임보다는 책을 쭉 읽어나가는 감각으로, 미스테리를 추적하면서, 기억을 더듬으면서 진실을 찾아가는 여정이 아름다웠고, 다시 보면 보이는 풀리지 않은 진실의 조각을 맟줘나가면소 정말, 푹 빠지게 되는 이야기였다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198359424035', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 5200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4864, 'last_played': 1590306468}
review:
[h1]SeaBed——像一朵孤独的流云[/h1]

       在高中的时候里我常常是数着日子过的，只想撕日历一般地飞过这没用的三年，而当我走出高考的考场以后，我却只希望时光能过得慢一些，再慢一些，慢到能让我有足够的东西来回味，慢到我再也不会忘记这段时光。

       说来有点奇怪，但我对某部gal有着一样的情感。（gal，VN，AVG，随便你怎么叫）和它本身一样，它有一个特别的名字，seabed。在汉化没有出来的今天，除了steam上面少的可怜的介绍，你甚至都百度不到它。

       gal或许不是最好的词，因为不像别的gal会用立绘，CV，BGM等等来辅助阅读或者帮你沉浸入故事之中，甚至鲜有任何媚宅的元素，你可以剥去这些只看文本本身却一样能品味到100%的seabed，而它的文本，别说是gal，我甚至没有看过类似的读物。

我曾想过以像“鉴赏家”评论作品一样分别罗列出它的优缺点来试着评价它，但总是以写完又删然后怀疑这样做是否有意义来收尾，重复以上步骤几次以后，我闭上眼，开始回想这部作品真正打动我的是什么。

       许多气泡在我阴暗的脑海里转了一圈，有什么自然而然地浮上了表面。

       孤独。

       听起来不错，就从这里开始吧。

       开始的半个小时或许会让你以为这是一个甜甜的Girls Love Story，背景框里带着花瓣和滤镜的那种，只不过有一点区别：它是乱序的，而且节奏很慢。当你继续往下，渴望搞清楚它在讲什么或者只是期待更多的福利场景的时候，作者扔下了第一颗炸弹，你发现这不是一个简单的爱情故事，而是类似电视里播放的那种抑郁患者走出自闭如何走出困境又或者受伤的人如何应对创伤后应激障碍的故事。至此，序章结束。

       你急切地想弄明白到底发生了什么，但这好像是一部慢热的作品，作者又不紧不慢的跟你唠起了家常，甚至还若无其事的加了一条线，太多的日常，太多的形容词，太多的描写让人很容易忽略那作者留下的面包屑，一直到后来，事情渐渐的让你感到不对，（又或者说是开始浮出水面）突然的超展开让你怀疑是不是一下子少看了好几章，每当你以为你找到了答案，接下来的剧情又开始反转，变得愈发的扑朔迷离，你不断地推翻先前的结论，一直到终章，真相大白的时刻，但随之而来的并不是谜底揭晓一般的畅快，而是一种沉入海底的孤独，正如本作的名字——SeaBed。

       这是一个关于孤独的故事，它把一个人如何愈合伤口的过程重新解构，双线展开，再加上刻意的反转和欺骗使整个故事变得虚虚实实，幻想与现实纠结在一起，把整个故事打碎成拼图，（也怪不得有人说这是推理游戏）也把这个原本让人心碎的故事打扮得凄美。

       故事里的人物也是孤独的，它们因为不同的理由聚在疗养院，丧偶的设计师，荒废的疗养院里最后留下的护士，不适应社会而整天赖在床上的书虫，记忆障碍的家伙，被家业困在深山里的老板娘……每个人都像是深海里的鱼，一步也不愿意踏出自己的comfort zone，却又潜意识的聚在一起，渴望温暖。

       它不是一部没有缺点的作品，实际上，我甚至不会把它推荐给所有人，慢热的节奏，长得和《海市蜃楼之馆》有一拼的序章，（steam上的成就统计显示只有四分之一的人玩通了序章）啰嗦又冗长有时候让你恨不得C过去的铺垫，藏在铺垫里不用心找很容易就错过的伏笔和暗线，心理学专业知识的涉及，不够出彩的配乐，平平无奇的画风，不走寻常路甚至称得上是诡异的叙事方式，（最重要的是没有熟肉）都使得它的门槛显得太高。

       但当读完本篇，SEABED的字样显现在屏幕上，ED响起，制作人的名单开始播放的时候，很难不让泪水充盈着你的眼眶，可我并没有哭，只是静静地坐在屏幕前，像一朵孤独的流云。

       它不止感人，它引人孤独。

       就到这里吧，，，在不剧透的情况下评价这部作品真的很难。

author: {'steamid': '76561198287777213', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 1183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1183, 'last_played': 1573833120}
review:
スクリプトミスのようなものでメッセージが表示されなくなる段落？ページ？があって、きちんと理解できているのか分かりません。
色々な解釈ができるとは思うのですが、二人の関係がかけがえのないものだったという描写はとても良かったです。しかし、それが良くなればなるほど、物語のベースとなる悲しい出来事はどう解釈しても揺るがない事実のようで、それが足を引っ張ってしまい、なんとか頭の中でハッピーエンド[spoiler]（ここでは貴呼が記憶を回復して佐知子の元に戻れる未来）[/spoiler]に持ち込みたかったのですが、どうしてもそこにはたどり着けませんでした。
TIPSの読むタイミングで解釈が変わるとのことで、解放された瞬間に読んだのですが、良いタイミングではなかったのかもしれません。

author: {'steamid': '76561198029488823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1839, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1829, 'last_played': 1583808599}
review:
SeaBed gets the reader invested into a relationship and presents a mystery a little by little to hook the reader in for the long run.

It takes some time and patience to get into this story but after that, it makes sure to occupy the reader's mind even for weeks after they finish.

Without spoiling too much, SeaBed will hurt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048020250', 'num_games_owned': 575, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 1680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1630, 'last_played': 1637492593}
review:
Être haut classé sur VNDB ne suffit pas à être populaire, Seabed en est une parfaite illustration classée 123ème sur VNDB, ceci ne l’empêche pas d’être totalement inconnu, et pourtant c’est un visual novel avec une histoire et une écriture brillante, les tout donnant une expérience très unique et plaisante.

Pour parler du jeu en évitant de trop gâcher la découverte, c’est un visual novel kinetic (pas de choix donné au joueur) de mystère qui se construit sur les troubles psychologiques des personnages, en effet Sachiko, l’une des protagonistes que l’on suit dans l’histoire est victime d’hallucinations, elle voit dans la vie de tous les jours son amante qui est portée disparu, on essaye donc de démêler le vrai du faux et aussi de comprendre l’origine de ses hallucinations. On suit donc avec grand intérêt l’intrigue pour essayer de démêler le vrai du faux, toute la réflexion que le jeu force au joueur rend la révélation de la solution finale très jouissive.

Afin de résoudre les mystères, le jeu nous donne trois protagonistes donc trois points de vue différents, on suit donc la vie, les souvenirs et aventures de nos personnages. Bien que de nombreuses scènes en apparence semblent être des slices of life sans importance ce ne sont que des impressions car le texte dissimule et cache des indices pour résoudre les mystères, ou alors introduit des idées qui prendront leur importance que plus tard.

Le jeu prend de longs moments à caractériser ses protagonistes afin qu’on s’y attache ce qui rend l’histoire plus attrayante, les personnages secondaires sont aussi très appréciables.

Au niveau graphismes, la plupart des backgrounds utilisent la technique ryukishi07, à savoir photo avec filtre, ce qui n’est pas gênant en soi, on pourra s’amuser à reconnaitre des rues italiennes ou encore le pont du Golden Gate. Le jeu contient énormément de CG qui sont d’ailleurs de très bonne qualité. Les sprites n’ont pas de style particulièrement original mais ils sont appréciables à regarder.

Au niveau audio, Seabed n’est pas en reste, bien que les musiques soient libres de droits, elles sont très sympathiques et même certaines pistes qui sont très bonnes. Les pistes ont été bien sélectionnées et elles s’accordent toujours très bien avec les différentes ambiances. De plus, le jeu est plutôt généreux sur les bruitages qui mettent bien dans l’ambiance.

Pour conclure, c’est une histoire que je conseillerais même à ceux qui n’apprécient pas le girl love car ça reste un mystère très solide avec une écriture sublime, par ailleurs, il existe une démo du jeu disponible dans le cas où vous doutez avant de passer à la caisse

author: {'steamid': '76561198413266831', 'num_games_owned': 15548, 'num_reviews': 215, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1561404359}
review:
[h1]前言[/h1]
《SeaBed》，由Paleontology制作Fruitbat Factory发行的一款带百合元素的GALGAME。故事围绕三个角色展开：女主角Sachiko、青梅竹马Takako、奇特的医生Narasaki，叙事手法非常奇特，三人不同的视角分别讲述，最终拼凑成一个完整的故事，同时游戏在心理描写和细节刻画上着实下了一番功夫，通篇下来，游戏展现的故事让人感触良多。

[h1]优点[/h1]
[b]+还算可以的立绘
+奇特的叙事手法
+刻画良好的细节和心理描写
+优美动听的音乐
[/b]
[h1]缺点[/h1]
[b]-背景描绘比较粗糙
-没有CV
-有几段突兀的音乐空白期
-老旧不便的UI、设置
[/b]

[h1]游玩体验[/h1]
游戏的人物立绘不算精致，但也不算难看，人物大多在正常的审美标准以上。不过，场景的描绘就比较简陋了，采用了介于水彩画和油画之间的风格，称不上美观，细节处也没有体现出来。

音乐很棒，单独拿出来每段BGM都很动听，其中的钢琴曲尤为出色。细节上的音效做的很用心，钥匙碰撞声、时钟走动的滴答声......结合起来，带来了不错的代入感。不过，在整个游戏流程中，有几段突兀的空白期（没有背景bgm），加上没有CV，显得过于安静了。

游戏的一大亮点是叙事手法，非常奇特，三人不同视角分别叙事，最后融合在一起，加上丰富细腻的心理描写，虽然初始可能让人云里雾里，有点摸不着头脑，但到后期，当所有的故事线交汇在一起揭露真相时，相信大部分人会感到惊讶并为之触动。
在过往记忆中寻找青梅竹马的Sachiko会得到怎样的真相？
奇特的医生Narasaki又是从何而来，她的真实身份究竟是谁？
Takako究竟去往了何方，为何会与自己深爱的Sachiko分离？
这一切都留待玩家自己去发掘了~

游戏最为人诟病的一点想必就是它过于老旧的UI和设置界面了，游戏没有常见的文本框，而是文字直接显现在整个画面上，中途夹杂着一些画面变换，所以游玩时画面、立绘完全成了背景。友情提示一下：鼠标右键可以呼出选择菜单进行存读档、返回标题界面等操作，改显示方式、分辨率、开始自动模式等操作则需要将鼠标移到上方从窗口设置条中选取，有点麻烦。

[h1]总结[/h1]
一款还算不错的GAL，叙事手法很不错，不过故事有点晦涩难懂，加上没有中文，想要彻底了解三位主角故事间的深意以及背后的真相需要花费一定的时间，同时，游戏带百合元素，喜欢GAL的玩家不妨一试，百合厨不要错过！

[code]欢迎参观我的： [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/7421824]双鱼星✪ω✪皇家飛机场[/url]
如果你喜欢这篇评论，也麻烦点个赞，让更多人能够看到。[/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561198324746818', 'num_games_owned': 6580, 'num_reviews': 600, 'playtime_forever': 1178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 690, 'last_played': 1561120822}
review:
[quote]

[h1]前言[/h1]

《SeaBed》发行商[url=https://store.steampowered.com/publisher/fruitbatfactory]Fruitbat Factory[/url]发行的一款百合向的恋爱视觉小说游戏。视角是在Sachiko、Talako和Narasaki这三位主角来回切换拼凑一个完整的故事展现在玩家眼前，故事整体讲述的是Sachiko的一场心理疗伤之旅。游戏场景CG非常带有艺术风格，人物的立绘绘制的也是十分的精致，但是两者的绘制风格不一样，融为一体的时候有一点点违和感。

[h1]游戏体验[/h1]

[b][u]1️⃣游戏剧情：[/u][/b]
　　游戏总共有十二个章节，一个序章，十个正式章节以及一个终章。游戏故事由于是三个视角切换讲述，为了让玩家更容易理解剧情，游戏在开始菜单提供了TIPS来为玩家补足剧情，并且在游戏时右下角还会标记场景主角的名字。两位核心女主角的性格可谓是天差地别，一个活泼，天真烂漫，另一个则是大方得体，温柔娴淑。

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1775465697]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1775465697[/url]

　　整个故事其实就是Sachiko一个人的心理疗伤之旅。因为Sachiko不能释怀Talako因病而逝去的事实，将所有的正负面感情化身为这些虚虚实实的事物。Talako在Sachiko的疗伤之旅象征的是她自己对Talako无法释怀的感情，而医生Narasaki则是Sachiko在精神异常之后的救赎人格化身，外观与儿时Talako、Sachiko的一起不离身的玩偶非常相似（可以说就是娃娃的化身）。Narasaki在剧情中的主要任务就是帮助Sachiko整理错综紊乱的记忆，让Sachiko走出感情阴影，迎接另一段幸福的生活。

[b][u]2️⃣游戏画风：[/u][/b]
　　游戏的画风分为两种，一种是应用在游戏背景的画风——水彩画，这种画风绘制出来的背景给玩家的感觉非常像一副艺术作品。而另外一种画风则是普通视觉小说具有的动漫画风，应用于游戏的人物立绘，游戏的人物立绘绘制得也是十分的精细，清晰可见的给玩家呈现了角色的性格、特质，比如Sachiko的黑长直，显得她非常喜欢安静，而Talako则是调皮的双马尾，显得非常的活泼。

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1775465857]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1775465857[/url]

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1775456025]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1775456025[/url]

[b][u]3️⃣游戏配乐：[/u][/b]
　　游戏的背景音乐没有几首高节奏的曲目，基本所有的曲目都是非常的静谧，给人一种轻松舒适的感觉，更容易让玩家沉下心来体验游戏的整个流程。

[h1]总结及推荐人群[/h1]

[b]优点：[/b]

❤️ 丰富的剧情故事（必须细细平常，否则是看不懂游戏剧情的）

❤️ 双画风渲染出别样的剧情故事

❤️ 轻松舒适的背景音乐

[b]缺点：[/b]

💔 不支持简体中文

[b]推荐人群：[/b]

[b]百合GalGame爱好者[/b]

[quote]
游玩百态，将游玩心得用汉语化作玩家的指明灯，(๑•̀ㅂ•́)و✧
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/35402408/]点击这里关注汉化语录~[/url] 如果喜欢这个评测，请点个赞让更多人看见
[/quote]

[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198286290698', 'num_games_owned': 3044, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1563789880}
review:
[quote]
[h1][b]前言[/b][/h1]

SeaBed是一款百合题材的日式视觉小说，最初由Paleontology制作并于2016年1月25日在[url=https://www.dlsite.com/home/work/=/product_id/RJ170840.html]DLsite发行的日文版[/url]，后来经由发行商Fruitbat Factory在17年12月5日先后在MangaGamer与Steam上发行英文版（当然，没有删减日文），而且还提高了CG的分辨率，用词也非常得体，具体的英化心得和想法也可以去[url=https://steppingonheaven.wordpress.com/2018/08/21/seabed-flitting-through-scenes-of-reality/]他们的博客看看[/url]，随后又有着俄罗斯的民间俄语化团队Entuziasty Team完成了[url=https://vk.com/wall-73391729_7153]俄语的民间本地化工作[/url]

这么看来本作也有了一定历史了，但在我一番搜寻之后发现在国内乃至中文玩家圈子里有关这款游戏的信息少之又少，更别说汉化了连贴吧仅有的寥寥几人最后也都不欢而散了，是这部作品不配吗？我想大概不是，视觉小说数量多之又多佳作也不在少数，对于没有官方中文且名气不大的制作组的游戏来说，要在国内获取足够关注本就是一件很困难的事，更别说本作的制作组也只有一部作品产出，在推特上也没有多大名气关注者仅400人不到，不被国内玩家注意到自然是很正常的

那么本作的质量到底怎样，还请随我慢慢道来

[table]
    [tr]
        [th]优点[/th]
        [th]不足[/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]细腻的文笔[/td]
        [td]用不了VNR[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]清新的画风[/td]
        [td]很多晦涩单词[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]诡异的叙事手法[/td]
        [td]故事背景复杂[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]饱满的角色塑造[/td]
        [td][/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]

[h1][b]音画表现[/b][/h1]

因为本作更像传统意义的视觉小说，所以在很多时候文字都是以全屏的方式表现，所以在画面演出上自然就不必有太高期待了，到也不是说本作画面就很差，正如在商店页面看到的一样，虽然可以看出CG里的场景有很多偷工减料的痕迹，但正如游戏名一般采用了很多淡雅的色调，CG也有90张左右而且每一张都非常清新耐看，并且在这细腻的字里行间更是大大增强了临场感，至少在画面上我是非常满意的

而在音乐方面，在刚进游戏时给人的感受就非常神秘,空灵，并且在这乱叙的节奏下更是让人感到倾佩，也不知道是不是我个人原因，BGM总是能在我阅读到最恰当的地方响起，随之而来的感动,惊愕,忧伤等等感情实在难以一一言表，并且在一些特殊情景也会有一些独特的音效，就算没有华丽的画面但沉浸感真的太棒了，虽然本作也没有CV但这部作品本身也是着重描写动作,环境,心里等非直接表述的部分，所以为了不破坏这种氛围没有CV可能才是最恰当的选择，综合来看很难让人相信本作是这制作组的第一部也是唯一一部作品，真的非常出色

[h1][b]游玩体验[/b][/h1]

虽然本作题材非常吸引我，百合,精神,多主角等等要素也非常有趣，客观来说无论是从叙事风格还是角色塑造来看本作质量也非常高，音乐也很有感染力，但还是不得不承认语言确实是游玩过程中最大的阻碍，虽然我有一定的日语知识在此之前也啃过一些日语生肉，但也是借助了VNR,喵翻等工具将一些不认识的单词翻译后才能顺利推完

但在本作中我尝试了很多方法都不能正常使用VNR，所以在我硬着头皮推了几小时之后实在是感到开始越来越看不懂，并且错过了很多重要信息，本作剧本体量也非常大，按官方的说法也有47万字，而且频繁出现的一些陌生单词也在不断冲刷我的耐心，如果按照我这个速度估计得推上一个月甚至更久，不得已只能作罢，如果后续有办法能用上了VNR我应该会在推完后再写一篇详细的评测，本次就说说这几小时的游玩体验吧

因为个人原因游玩的是日文版，在我这几小时的游玩中也是遇到了很多晦涩难懂的部分，其中除了一部分有我日语水平不够的原因我想也是本作大量采用了倒叙,插叙等手法，在我之后查找了下终于在贴吧看到[url=https://tieba.baidu.com/p/5523549438]一篇大佬发的评测[/url]，这对我理解剧情有不少帮助，感兴趣的可以去那边看看，在细细阅读之后我更是确定了本作是一款佳作的想法

在初进游戏就能明显感受到本作的复古味道，因为背景建立在上个世纪80年代末期，在一些建筑,对话等描写文本以及音乐,画面等各部分内容上能够清晰感到，特别是在一些细小的动作有时也会花费不少笔墨来描写，这也是得益于视觉小说这种表现形式，若是以常规gal那样常常会让人抓不到重点甚至是有些奇怪

在最初的“惊艳”过后随着流程推进会遇到越来越多不同时间线乃至不同世界观下的情节，而这也是本作的魅力所在，所以也常常让我有种看得懂文字但是看不懂故事的感受，不过并不是说这些“非主线”情节不够出色，而是因为它们往往与我们用一般眼光来看的主线没有太大联系，不过我相信它们是作为伏笔的存在,与主线是有联系的，大概在故事后面还有揭露只是我没有玩到那些部分，在后来看了上文提到的那位大佬的帖子我也就释怀了，不过那位大佬在帖子里也写了相当多的剧情，如果不想被剧透的话还是...别一口气看到最后

[h1][b]总体感受[/b][/h1]

总的来说本作在文字和音乐的搭配上也已经达到了非常高的水准，每个角色也大都通过大量的间接描写得到丰满，画面虽然有些简陋不过也相当淡雅清新非常贴合SeaBed这个名字，故事实际上也很曲折，再通过很多插叙倒叙手法和频繁的生僻词让本作更加晦涩难懂，而目前也没有汉化,VNR也不可用可以说是最大的阻挠，但如果你的英文或是日文水平足够，而且是视觉小说爱好者的话，请千万不要错过这款作品

其实我觉得我是没法写这款游戏的评测的，因为很多东西我都没有搞懂游戏也没有打通，但还是想借此机会让这款游戏稍微曝光一下，之后有机会能够打通的话我会补上长评的（如果打通的话），如果有汉化组想要接手本作工作的话我也想帮忙
[/quote]
[quote]sbeam丧尽天良，我与黄游共存亡！加入[url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/sqyx]色情游戏组[/url]，发掘好玩的黄...呸，不是黄油我们也要评测！
也可以顺便关注我们的鉴赏家：[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34401083]色情鉴赏[/url]，虽然不全是黄油的评测，不过我们也很用心在写评测的！[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198351519653', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 2284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1294, 'last_played': 1560704620}
review:
《SeaBed》是一款非常奇特的百合题材的视觉小说作品。我玩的视觉小说作品，虽然没有特别多，但也是达到一定数量了，而这种类型的游戏，我也是不多见。

相比起普通视觉小说只有一位主角而言，本作游戏的一共有三位主角，而游戏的剧情也以三位主角的视觉来分别讲述。她们在不同的时间，不同的地点，发生着不一样的故事，这些视角之间的切换，向我展示出她们之间是如何相识，相知到相爱。她们在不同的地方旅行，不同的地点加上不同的时间点，在这之间不断跳跃，逐渐拼凑出一部爱情故事。
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1769536856
当然爱情故事也不全都是美好的，更何况本作中的爱情故事的起因还是与精神疾病有关，这也就表明了本作中的故事不可能像大部分百合游戏一样以欢快为基调。你可以在游戏中看到大量的心理描写，语言对话，人物动作等等。字里行间展现出非凡的细节水平，能让玩家完全感受到游戏想要表达的情感。
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1769536599
由于本作中并没有CV，所以说其中的背景音乐就尤为重要。而游戏中的背景音乐的选取，堪称大师级，舒缓平静而又悠扬的音乐，略带一丝悲伤的气息，带动了整个游戏的氛围，让这款文字游戏不再单调，特别是在高潮处的音乐，往往异常动人，引人入胜。

游戏中的立绘做得还算可以，不过因为游戏中的对话不像普通游戏一样用对话框来描述，而是在整个游戏画面里展示，所以立绘方面在游戏中的感受其实不是特别深刻。不过比起存在感不足的立绘，游戏中的cg做得就非常出色了，如果说立绘只能算中等偏下，那么cg完全就是上等水准，特别是由于主角们各种旅行，经常可以看到不同的服装，各种精致的背景，再加上水彩式的画风，让所有cg都给我带来一种如梦似幻般的感受。可惜的是游戏并不支持steam自带截图，想要截图上传还是得费一番功夫的。
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1769535922
这是一款非常优美的百合类型视觉小说作品，它的游戏节奏较慢，所以可能一些喜欢快节奏游戏的玩家并不是特别喜欢体验它。但如果你能静下心来体验它，那它绝对不会辜负你的期望。 

[quote]
我的游戏真的有那么好玩吗?
关注[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34823631/]鉴赏家[/url],这是你从未体验过的船新版本~
[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198393895951', 'num_games_owned': 1507, 'num_reviews': 1228, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1560340202}
review:
[h1] 游戏介绍	[/h1]
《Seabed》是一款由Paleontology制作，Fruitbat Factory发行的百合恋爱类型的AVG游戏。游戏讲述了水野佐知子和贵呼之间的百合恋爱故事，可是由于贵呼得了一种病离开了，导致佐知子也有一些问题，这样的变故让俩人便不能在一起，游戏也就由此展开，于是便有了游戏中的剧情，让我们来细细品尝其中剧情的韵味。

[h1] 游戏的画风	[/h1]
游戏的背景图片主要以水彩画和一般的图片向大家进行展示，虽然是俩种不同的风格，但是却很融洽的向玩家进行了展现，没有感到不适应的感觉，然后就是游戏的CG的部分，数量十分的多，于是大大的提升了游戏中人物的特性，而且更能让我感受到俩位女主之间的亲密的关系，还有就是医生对俩人的巨大的关爱，这些都显得十分的淋漓尽致。

[h1]游戏的音乐 	[/h1]
游戏的背景音乐主要给我的感觉就是静谧，也许为了和主题Seabed照应，这样的感觉十分的不错，而且也为游戏的节奏提供了不错的渲染，有着十分良好的游戏气氛，这样让我可以更好体验到其中俩人的不解之缘。

[h1] 游戏的剧情	[/h1]
游戏的剧情给我感觉就是深邃，不太易懂，但是玩过去之后细细想想，貌似能找到其中的一些头绪，医生也许并不是一个人，而是佐知子和贵呼原先小时候玩的那个布偶娃娃，但是由于贵呼的先行离去，导致佐知子有点抑郁，不能摆脱其中其中的悲伤，于是创造了一个自己的世界，医生的出现就是为了治疗她的病，想将佐知子带回来，让她忘却这段现实，其中有一个最大的问题是，俩个世界中由于俩人的记忆是不同步的，所以导致有很多事情不能讲明，这时他俩的日记就是最好的武器，这本日记很好的将俩人的记忆带了回来，也为最后的恢复做出了巨大贡献。游戏的描写十分的多，而且伏笔也很多，有时需要好好的思考才能理清游戏的来龙去脉，而且对于人物的性格的塑造我认为也是十分的不错的，所以是一部剧情上十分不错的游戏。

[h1] 游戏的优点	[/h1]
+具有内涵的剧情
+人物的性格塑造
+巨多数量的CG
+静谧的BGM

[h1] 游戏总评	[/h1]
总体来说，这是一款十分不错的百合类恋爱AVG游戏的，而且剧情充满内涵，所以推荐给喜欢百合AVG游戏的玩家。
评分8/10

as a forewarning, the story can be slow to some. for me, the world seabed has created for itself is so breathtaking, so magical, that the slow pace of it all never bothered me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970296271', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 2680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2680, 'last_played': 1557132718}
review:
There is not much point describing the details, given this is a mystery novel, so I'll just recommend this to people who like contemplative and slow moving novels. It is a full length novel, first and foremost, rather that your typical "choose your route" affair you see these days.

I'd say if you enjoyed VN:s like "The House in Fata Morgana", this might be up your alley as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999125917', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1660, 'last_played': 1556714629}
review:
[h1]SeaBed is an underappreciated gem in this [i]now[/i] flooded market of visual novels. [/h1]

I didn't know what to expect when I started reading. And honestly, it was hard to get into at first. The prologue would simply not hook me. But once the plot points started dropping, I was fully dedicated to the story. This is not something you rush, however. Take your time reading the story. It's a slow burn, not something you speed through and binge in a day. 

The time I spent reading this was one hell of an experience. The more you read, the more it leaves you confused and the more you understand, the more you want to know. The kind of, "I really want to spoil myself, but I don't want to be spoilered!" feeling. And take that by heart. No spoilers. The mystery is what makes this so good. And by the time I neared the end, I could not stop crying. This is someone who rarely cries at fiction.

If you want a good story that will leave an impression on you and a hole in your heart, this is for you. If you're someone who needs everything spoonfed to you, I can't say you'll enjoy it as much, but I would still recommend you give it a chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198287935951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 5250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5248, 'last_played': 1680010876}
review:
백합 미스터리 비쥬얼노벨 Sea Bed 입니다.

선택지가 없는 단일루트 단일엔딩 게임입니다.
미스터리에 걸맞게, 초중반은 떡밥을 뿌리면서 넘기고 후반부에 떡밥을 회수하는 구조로 되어 있습니다.

진짜 뭐라 말을 하기가 좀 그렇고, 직접 한 번 해 보세요.
이 게임을 하면서 겪게 되는 모든 경험 하나하나가 정말 소중합니다.

과거와 현재, 일상 그리고 비일상.

정말 여운이 많이 남아요. 꼭 한번 해보셨으면 합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198841011254', 'num_games_owned': 87, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1003, 'last_played': 1598771712}
review:
作为一个百合厨看到封面我就没忍住买下来…
凭我六级水准啃不动…（哭死）
但是忍不住就很喜欢这一作、
喜欢但是犹豫买不买的话可以稍微观望一下、
不过好几篇英文测评里我大致看出了本作故事的影子
——这个故事很美
期待她被关注的那一天吧
（或者继续被大多数人遗忘也挺好？）

9102.30.41
我硬着头皮连夜通了本游戏的一周目
——我的感觉没错
这个故事真的很美、很美
到最后我终于稍微了解到了本作——SeaBed这个名字的含义
这真的是个好故事，感情刻骨铭心，也让我看完故事之后觉得挺扎心
感觉我还是在过程中忽略了些什么，CG最终还是缺少了三张，按steam成就来看的话我虽然通了结束曲，但是依旧没有解锁本作的一个隐藏成就[spoiler]『Journey』[/spoiler]与本作唯一的一个非隐藏成就『Completed SeaBed』等我缓缓来二周目仔仔细细再理一下剧情…
[spoiler](现在的话…如果你也读了本作后却有和我相似的困扰就请点开完整测评往下看完本人的废话吧233)[/spoiler]
非常美的一作、推荐食用

[spoiler]写在之后：
已经全成就全CG达成…
最终扎心却又令人释然的
是在一周目后提示解锁的Tips中最后的『Journey』
整个故事到此才算是画上句号
因为一周目后我还纠结于章节剧情忽视了最后的Tips
不过也好、现在看完不知为何觉得好受些了

这份感情就刻在我心中的海底
SedBed[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198304974200', 'num_games_owned': 1857, 'num_reviews': 209, 'playtime_forever': 2779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2575, 'last_played': 1551570143}
review:
[h1]Um estudo psicológico sobre amor[/h1]
Sea Bed é um jogo maravilhoso! É difícil fazer uma análise sem dar spoilers do jogo, então tentarei ser breve.
A escrita do jogo foge muito do padrão de visual novels, não há "cenas anime fofas", a escrita é como a de um livro normal (o que não é algo ruim), os backgrounds na maioria são fotografias, a arte é muito bonita e simples. A história se desenvolve de forma lenta, mas tenha paciência pois há alguns mistérios e uma drama fortemente sentimental que culminam num final maravilhoso. A história é voltada a tema psicológico, mas não tenha medo que não é nada cheio de termos complexos, apenas várias trocas de perspectivas e linhas de tempo. Resumindo, é um bom jogo mais voltado para fãs de visual novels que também gostam de livros e temas psicológicos com romance.

[h1] A psychological study of love [/h1]
Sea Bed is a wonderful game! It's hard to do an analysis without spoilers of the game, so I'll try to be brief.
The writing of the game runs away from the standard of visual novels, there are no "cute anime scenes", writing is like a normal book (which is not a bad thing), backgrounds are mostly photographs, art is very beautiful and simple. The story unfolds slowly, but be patient as there are some mysteries and a strongly sentimental drama that culminate in a wonderful ending. The story is psychologically focused, but do not be afraid that it's not full of complex terms, just multiple exchanges of perspectives and timelines. In short, it's a good game more for fans of visual novels who also love books and psychological themes with romance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198345719169', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1547991994}
review:
I just simply could not get immersed in the story as I have with other visual novels I've played. I'm sure it does get better later on, but after 30 minutes of playing, I realised this was not a style of storytelling I was personally a fan of and wasn't worth the money I had spent.

This visual novel is for people who enjoy reading a lot of books. This has detailed and lengthy dialogue which can be hard to keep focus if you are not accustomed to it, so if you're new to visual novels/don't read much, you may get overwhelmed and burnt out after about half an hour.

I'd personally say to give this a go. You may like it if you are accustomed to reading detailed books with a story you have to really think about.

If you are just looking for something you can read and enjoy without too much thought, I'd say to look elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023544644', 'num_games_owned': 426, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 3515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1599598210}

author: {'steamid': '76561198168485644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 829, 'last_played': 1586899623}
review:
Up there with Fun Home as one of the greatest works of LGBT art this century, of not ever.  Staunchly anti-fantasy based entirely on social psychology, memory, and relationship building.  One of the few games that has ever made me cry, a true standout for storytelling in videogames.   
  Unfortuanately I really can't elaborate further without spoiling, this is a game that you need to go into blind.  One of the most professional doujin works in any genre I have ever seen. 
 Recommended to: slice of life mange/anime fans, people starved for either nuanced realistic depictions of psychology and/or LGBT representation in games, psychological drama fans

author: {'steamid': '76561198010090636', 'num_games_owned': 592, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1280, 'last_played': 1561477040}
review: Seabed grants you pleasure from piecing the bits together, as well as noticing clever red herrings and foreshadowing. It has a decent amount of artwork for the medium-length doujin work. A lot of people find it pacing slow, but it's not that bad in my opinion, the last 4 chapters are extremely engaging and you read them eagerly in one breath. The game, however, has some descriptions which are a bit too thorough for my personal taste. The 'yuri' part of the story is almost non-existant, as the game explores the themes of memory and human psyche, rather than the theme of homosexuality. If you are experienced in the visual novel field or you feel like the game resonates with you on an entirely different level, go for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041378907', 'num_games_owned': 142, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 788, 'last_played': 1545223648}
review:
https://blog.naver.com/athelas222/222186285592
(한글화 해주신 분 블로그 링크입니다. 리뷰도 있어요.)

스팀에서 한글로 플레이 할 수 있는 몇 안되는 백합 비주얼 노벨입니다.
그런 점에서 리뷰를 추천으로 해놓긴 했는데... 솔직히 잘 모르겠네요. 일단 초반부가 너무 루즈합니다. 백합성분 좀 들어간 일상씬의 반복이에요. 근데 그 일상씬 가운데에서도 스토리가 조금씩 전개되고 떡밥도 뿌려지니 대충 읽고 넘기기도 그렇습니다. 오죽하면 프롤로그 끝내는 업적을 달성한 사람이 30%도 안됩니다(물론 프롤로그가 대여섯 시간 걸릴 정도로 길긴 하지만). 뭐 사람에 따라 차이가 있을 수도 있겠지만 저는 너무 지루하더군요.  

그래도 사람들 평가를 보면 스토리가 좋고 여운이 남는 작품이라고 하니 한번 해보시길 권합니다. 저는 (언제가 될 지 모르겠지만) 다 플레이하고 리뷰 수정할게요.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091884692', 'num_games_owned': 1644, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1479, 'last_played': 1538620149}
review:
※このレビューは本編の序盤の内容に触れます。

百合ミステリーノベルゲー。結構ボリュームがあります。
Tipsまで全部読んで20時間くらい。

犯人はお前だ！というようなミステリではなく、
どうなってるんだろう？とぼんやり考えながら読むようなタイプ。
---

この作品は佐知子と貴呼(ﾀｶｺ)の百合カップルのお話です。
しかし、早々に貴呼が失踪してしまいます。
佐知子は貴呼の幻覚を見るようになり、友人に助けを求めます。
幻覚の治療をするうち、貴呼は失踪ではなく、実は亡くなっていたことが明らかになります。
と、ここまでがプロローグ。

そして第一章。貴呼視点です。
いやいや、君さっき死んだじゃん！と思い読んでみると、
貴呼は貴呼で記憶障害を患い療養中なことがわかります。

さて、こうなると「どっちが現実か？」が分からなくなってきます。ここがこの作品の大きなミステリー要素なわけですね。

百合要素の方ですが、ただｲﾁｬｲﾁｬを描写するのではなく、
「あの子と一緒にこういうことをしたなあ」
「あの子のこういう部分が好きだったなあ」
と、お互いがいなくなってしまったお互いのことを思い出しながら語ることが多く、なかなか切ないです。
ただのｲﾁｬｲﾁｬが見たい人には向いてないかもしれません。

終わってみてじんわりと「あぁ、やってよかった」と思うような、
そんなゲームです。オススメ

本当にただの余談ですが、「深く深く、誰にも見つからない場所」
というこのゲームのキャッチコピーがすごく好きです

author: {'steamid': '76561197993362300', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1254, 'last_played': 1647299728}
review:
SeaBed is a story about dealing with loss, and coming out stronger on the other side. The main character, Sachiko, suffers from hallucinations of her former girlfriend, and seeks treatment to return to a more normal life. We follow her journey as she dives deep into her own psyche and ultimately comes to accept her past and move forward. The game is a kinetic novel where the player makes no choices, but simply follows along with the text. The story is engrossing enough that I would often lay in bed at night after playing, running though what I’ve learned in my head, trying to fit the clues into the broader narrative. The writing is superb, and of such quality that small discontinuities between scenes are important clues and not a product of poor writing (for example: there is a table with two chairs. One character sits in one chair and falls asleep. A second character enters the room and sits in the other chair. A third character enters the room and sits an empty chair, despite there only being two chairs in the room. This is an important clue about the true nature of one of the characters). It’s nice to play a game that rewards the reader for paying attention to the little things, as they herald bigger discoveries. My hunches were usually on the mark, yet the game is never heavy-handed with pointing out major revelations. Instead, they flow naturally, and fit like puzzle pieces into the broader narrative. It made me cry at several spots, but I’m easily affected by death, so your mileage may vary. The story is far from being always depressing though, and many scenes show the characters going on fun adventures. While these scenes don’t really propel the story forward, they do allow us to grow closer to the characters and care for them more deeply. The story wraps up very well at the end, tying up all the loose ends seamlessly. It’s so engrossing that I would actually feel a chill when a character would describe how cold she was feeling, even though I played this game in the middle of summer.

The CGs are colorful and well drawn, and the characters are well proportioned, but they have the slightly rough look of a doujin game. This doesn’t hurt the appeal of the characters, and, if anything, adds to the overall charm of the game. Most backgrounds are filtered photographs like in Tsukihime, but others are 3D CG models of high quality. I felt there was a bit of a discontinuity when the game would switch between the photographs and the 3D CG background between scenes, but it never breaks the immersion, and the text is always in agreement with the background (like if a character walks over to a bookshelf with a glass cabinet, there really is a bookshelf with a glass cabinet in the background. I really appreciate that level of attention to detail). The 3D CG backgrounds are so good, that I can’t help but wonder if the photograph backgrounds were placeholders that were just never replaced for whatever reason. At any rate, the art is pleasing and great to look at. 

The text is placed over the background instead of in a box at the bottom of the screen. This means that the speaker’s name isn’t displayed during dialogue, but the characters have such distinct ways of speaking that I almost always knew who was speaking, which is a tribute to the quality of the writing and translation. And on the few times that I wasn’t sure who was speaking, the characters would change their expressions often enough that it made it clear who was speaking again, so I never felt lost for long. There are a few typos, but they are minor and don’t effect the story.

The music is catchy and always fits the overall feel of the scene well. Upbeat tracks are used for happy scenes, and slower, more somber songs are used for mysterious or sad portions of the story. The use of certain tracks would kind of foreshadow how a scene was going to play out, but I guess that’s unavoidable with a story of this length (it took me 20 hours using the auto-read function). Sound effects are peppered throughout the story to enhance the text, and they fit so well I could almost smell an egg being fried when the sound effect of sizzling food was played.

Overall, I felt that SeaBed was an incredible journey, with a deeply engaging story and unforgettable characters. While I guess it wouldn’t be unfair to call it a nakige (crying game), it earns its tears through the quality of the writing and my attachment to the characters. It’s definitely worth the purchase for anyone interested in yuri or mystery games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046193538', 'num_games_owned': 701, 'num_reviews': 248, 'playtime_forever': 1194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1194, 'last_played': 1534707193}
review:
I went into SeaBed expecting nothing more than a Mystery VN with Yuri elements in it. And if you boiled down the tremendous amount of detail, narrative and developments down to its very core, those two things can describe this VN, although not doing the VN any of the justice it deserves; that's like calling a five-star restaurant's three-course meal simply "food."

SeaBed is a somewhat lengthy Kinetic Novel (i.e. there are no choices for the player to make that affect the path of the story) which I'd estimate is around 20 hours long. And I will say, the story is a very slow-burn; if you're not someone who's willing to appreciate all the details and follow a story through to the very end, SeaBed is not for you. If you're the kind of person who just glances and skips over dialogue thinking it won't be important, this story is definitely not for you. At first, it may appear as a mere Yuri Slice-Of-Life simulator where everything that's happening is filler, but even those moments are important; the end of the (rather lengthy) prologue slams you with an introductory plot twist that makes you question the events of the entire story, including the prologue you just read. Because of this, the story can be a bit hard-to-follow sometimes, but it's structured that way on purpose and it isn't meant to simply confuse the reader.

SeaBed is quite an experience that kept me thinking, questioning and feeling things with each chapter. I had many questions, and each time a question seemed to get answered, I'd have even more questions. However, after the end credits [spoiler]and reading the extra scenes unlocked after the end, after reading the very last 3 lines of the entire story, everything clicked into place.[/spoiler] I absolutely recommend SeaBed, even at full price. This type of story is very difficult to recommend without spoiling anything, but it's definitely worth it if you enjoy a narrative that provides immersive detail and being very subtle about "there's something strange happening" but just enough to keep you wanting more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198210923575', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1010, 'last_played': 1531400470}
review: Expected a cute Yuri story with a bit of mystery, but got a heartwrenching drama about dealing with loss that totally destroyed me instead, and I loved every second of it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198396821481', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1964, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1160, 'last_played': 1530939203}
review:
去年入的这个游戏，看着百合的tag就买了。买回来发现盯着英语生肉啃，啃不下去放弃了。时隔半年我又一次打开了这个游戏，并且意外地被它所深深地吸引了。
SeaBed，一个你百度都查不到百科的游戏，一个冷门到汉化组都懒得翻译的游戏，在我对着英文看的一知半解的情况下，让我一个已经20岁的老女人泪流满面地通关了剧情。
在我看来，这个游戏不仅仅是一个游戏，它已经达到了艺术品的级别。剧本，音乐，美术表现，每一项都能达到神作的标准。打开主界面，清澈的钢琴声幽然响起，冷色调的画面铺展开，一股浓浓的大海的气息扑面而来。游戏的最后一张 CG，主角Sachiko缓缓沉入海底，ed的钢琴声随之而来，我的心也仿佛一同沉入了海底。没有夸张的生离死别，没有玩味卖弄的百合，整个游戏显得是这样的清爽、干净。令人痛彻心扉的剧本，却在不经意间将玩家治愈。ed中，Sachiko与Takako所曾经历过的点点滴滴，如同幻灯片一般在眼前播放着，最后，两人都放下了对彼此的执念。镜头定格在两人的最后一次旅行中，Sachiko与Takako在满天繁星下拥吻的画面。如此令人感到炫目。
我想到的第一个词，就是炫目。
SeaBed是一个平凡，低调的游戏，而在我看来，却是如此的炫目。如果你刚接触galgame，那么我并不推荐你，一是生肉很难啃，再加上seabed又是对话很少，心理和景物描写很多的那种类型，读起来就更加费力，二是seabed的回忆太多，剧情线过于繁杂，更像是一个小说，而不是游戏。但如果你想体验如同key社般催泪的剧情和超一流的剧本，那么请一定不要错过这款seabed。

author: {'steamid': '76561198029934580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2809, 'last_played': 1560824717}
review:
It's a very good yuri VN.

In many ways this is not the kind of VN I would normally rank highly, it is slow, and essentially not much happens at times, but still it drags me in, kind of like "One more turn" syndrome you'll see from Civ.

The characters are complleing, I want to see more, even if its just the simple Slice of life stuff, which incidentally is what comprises probably close to 80% of the VN.

The music is good too, although I heard it is freeware. Most of the backgrounds are also simple, or fudged photos. Their event CGs are simple yet charming.

Do wish they released an artbook though, and pity they probably cannot release a soundtrack OST.

author: {'steamid': '76561198287062183', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1529760286}
review:
Although this VN takes a lot of time describing the mundane everyday life of its characters, the mystery aspect does a good job of keeping the reader engaged until the end. Especially the unreliable narrator keeps you guessing on how much of what's happening is actually real.
This reads a lot like a proper novel and similarly one could probably write a pretty decent literary analysis of this story, since everything has it's place and plays into the central themes of the novel.
Recommended for everyone who can enjoy stories that go on their own pace.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997074607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 920, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 920, 'last_played': 1529042180}
review:
SeaBed. A nice yuri story that isn't about the sex and actually has an interesting story. Interesting, yet confusing. This has a few pacing issues, as stated by others, and I won't lie, I kept falling asleep on some parts. To the point where I just plainfully stopped reading. But then I suddenly wanted to pick this up again and it got GOOD. That kept me going.

So definitely the first half of the game is pretty slow, you may want to fall asleep a few times, but trust me, and the other reviews: it DOES get good. Feels definitely do get played, and I love that.

The ending was pretty... confusing. To me, at least. Not that it was a bad ending, per say. I just couldn't wrap everything up, and that kind of sucks. Even with the TIPS (which is HIGHLY recommended you read after unlocking them for more understing and lore), I'm still somewhat at a lost, but I kind of get it.

I really loved the music, although I heard it's just "freeware" music. Regardless, they were well put for the situations that happened.

Overall, I'd give this a 7/10. Would give it an 8, if the story/ending in general was more clear.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136214992', 'num_games_owned': 350, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 1930, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1930, 'last_played': 1526837125}
review:
Around 7/10 recommended. This is the sort of VNs that if you like it, it would be a very good experience; but if you don't like it, it's hard to finish the VN itself. The text are very good (almost like reading a real-world novel, which is actually not that usual in today's VNs), the music is really on-the-spot, and the CGs are pretty good and fit the story itself.

This VN also take some unusual themes: adult lesbian couple, mental illness, mystery and loss of long-term relationship. The text itself contains a lot of metaphors. And just by reading the text, I usually find myself in a slightly meditative state.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994048123', 'num_games_owned': 118, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 4332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3, 'playtime_at_review': 4311, 'last_played': 1711651684}
review: SeaBed its a VN off the curve, the slow pace, flashback, and how little by little the pieces of a giant and complex puzzle starts to gain it form. But, thats exactly why it is such a good VN when combined with an extremely rich, and quite dynamic text that moves on as you know more the story. plus, by making you think what might or might not happen its something that I love. Putting the reader out of its confort zone, and the need to think out the box, it is just right.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998887445', 'num_games_owned': 1095, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 1470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 756, 'last_played': 1561072468}
review:
This VN is an excellent change of page. It's slow, but feels like an actual novel. It's entirely lacking in the usual mystery-type plots involving murders or kidnappings or what-have-you, instead being based around mental health, what is real and what is not, and being able to understand what you're being told.

The story is very well written, with no typos that I spotted, and a delicately made world that feels wonderfully put together without bragging about it. The backgrounds are all right, usually being either pictures with oil painting filters on (these look kinda ugly to me, but hey), or 3D modelled backgrounds (some of these are beautiful, especially one of the libraries, although some seem rather more ugly). The music tends towards simplistic, but is by no means bad or dull, and really adds to the whole experience.

There were a couple of moments that nearly made me cry (which is an achievement), and I was glad to see that whilst the answers are there, they're not always given on a silver platter. If you don't consider what you're being shown, you will not understand anything. Chances are you'll be rather confused over timing and reality for a lot of the early game in any event, but try to work it out without getting annoyed by the fact it's not giving you that information.

The character sprites are well made, with all but the most minor of characters having their own model. The sprites not only have a lot of expressions, but a suprisingly wide variety of clothing that actually makes them feel more real.

I only have a couple of gripes about the  game. Firstly, the tips are only accessable from the main menu rather than  having an easy transition from the game, which meant I tended to watch them in bulk later on, making them less relevant to the actual game, and meaning I had to sit through the introduction screen each time I wanted to view them. Secondly, the credits for me bugged out and started flickering like crazy. It took me about 15 hours to complete, which means at full price it's just about value for money (£1 for 1 hour), but the hours are excellent, so I would say it's about worth full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009272545', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1789, 'last_played': 1522929653}
review: If you like yuri or mystery this is a very deep and unique experience that I would recommend to anyone. I have never seen something quite like SeaBed before, this is a story that is emotional in many unexpected ways and that hooked me from the prologue like no other game. The less you know about this visual novel before you start the better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062669283', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1176, 'last_played': 1696911759}
review: A heartrending story of love. Amazing read.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084611553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1585266021}
review:
(While it says I only have 5 hours on record, I played through most of this VN in offline mode, so take that in mind).

Seabed can be a rather confusing and even frustrating experience at first if you go in expecting a traditional narrative structure. The story jumps from one place to another, usually placing its focus on scenes that are mundane by nature: a day at school, an afternoon shopping, maybe a trip or a car drive. In a traditional story, these scenes would be considered "filler", as they don't push the plot forward in any way or offer substantial character development.

It's that same mundanity, however, what makes this VN shine above others. Seabed is more preoccupied with exploring the relationship between Sachiko and Takako and their memories together ("memory" being an important theme all throughout the story) than anything that could be considered "exciting". It's a slow ride, one that takes even its most surprising revelations with an "as a matter-of-factly" tone. It's contemplative, it's quiet, it can even be "boring" under a certain scope, but for these same reasons it's a rather rewarding experience. Don't worry, the plot has its big twists and turns (it's labeled as a mystery for a reason), and there's a lot of romance to go around, avoiding the usual pitfalls of being too edgy/dark or too overwhelmingly optimistic to tell you a story that just kinda *is*.

In other words, Seabed is one of the best JPVNs to reach our shores in recent memory, so definitely give it a go if you're in the need of something special.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031654661', 'num_games_owned': 3513, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 1140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1057, 'last_played': 1518705654}
review:
SeaBed is a great yuri/mystery visual novel and I can easily say that it's my favourite visual novel that Fruitbat Factory have localised. I went into it completely blind since I purchased it in a Fruitbat Factory bundle and was surprised to find a world with memorable characters and a great mystery. The game mostly focuses on the two main characters, Sachiko and Takako, and their memory issues. Sachiko has hallucinations of Takako in her everyday life after her sudden disappearance while Takako forgets her memories.

The most interesting part of the game for me is that for most of the game you never see these characters together outside of flashbacks and memories. I was worried about this at first since I thought the game would just end up being all about these memories but they're spaced out pretty well. They're also fun to read because Sachiko and Takako went on a lot of trips together, so there's a lot of different scenery. The game also switches perspectives between these characters every chapter, and they both have their own set of characters. I found all of the side characters to be likable in their own way, and to be honest, they appear so much in the story that they don't even really feel like side characters.

SeaBed also features an excellent presentation. I'm a fan of most of the character designs (the library lady in one scene creeps me out) and they are all very expressive. Sometimes there will be small animations which are nice. There's also a lot of CGs, backgrounds, and sound effects to add to the atmosphere. The soundtrack is also fantastic - it's catchy, the songs fits the scenes they're played in. Sadly the songs seem to be royalty free so I can't buy the soundtrack...

All this being said, I do have a few issues with the game: 
- The translation is pretty good but there are a lot of typos, this may be fixed in the future. 
- The game doesn't tell you which character is talking, this isn't an issue most of the time but sometimes I get confused on who is speaking, especially when a new page of text opens with dialogue.
- There are a few characters that appear for the prologue and only have a short appearance near the end and it was a little sad to never see them again.
- I had a weird crash when I opened the Steam Overlay which forced me to replay from my last save.

All of these issues are minor overall though, and if this review got you interested in the game then I recommend you check it out!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009374496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1216, 'last_played': 1518386338}
review:
The best thing I can say about this game is that I was surprised when I saw my 20 hours playtime after finishing. It didn't feel nearly that long, which is a good sign.

The characters and their interactions remain interesting throughout as you proceed through the story.

The story deals with themes of memory, letting go, and moving on. It manages to maintain a hopeful and positive tone, which is nice.

A minor nitpick is that some of the things the characters say come in a giant wall of text if it's just one character saying several things without interruption. I feel this might look a bit better if it were broken down a bit more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110877306', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 7878, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3288, 'last_played': 1627659553}
review:
这在我看来已经不是一个游戏那么简单了，它的故事搭配上CG、动人的音乐等要素，更像是件艺术品，美的让人心碎，又虐的我痛彻心扉。已经好多年没有接触过这么能打动我的作品了~
我花了50个小时看了两遍才大致看懂这个虐心的故事，好多细节和伏笔都埋的很深，需要耐心发掘才能找出真相。对于英语不是太好的中国玩家来说，把这个故事全部理解透彻可能有些困难。
我在百度贴吧写了篇对游戏剧情等完整具体的论述，有兴趣的可以去看看，链接：http://tieba.baidu.com/p/5523549438?share=9105&fr=share&see_lz=0&sfc=copy&client_type=2&client_version=10.3.8.0&st=1565400296&unique=B70B53D4D16F5166A5703E4B2BAEA99B
汉化已出，感谢发起汉化的南风叔等人，感谢汉化组所有成员的为爱发电，感谢组内主席等大佬的夜以继日的校对润色，衷心感谢你们~
如果你一开始没读懂这个游戏，我可以给你两个提示：[spoiler]1.Takako的世界是Sachiko心中的世界。2.Narasaki是Sachiko和Takako儿时玩的布娃娃的化身。[spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198241739398', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 435, 'last_played': 1516627434}
review:
ひぐらしをプレイしているような印象をうけた作品。
面白い部分にたどり着くまでが長いし、ページめくりも面倒。内容の前に根気のある人向け。
デモがあるので、買う前に試した方が良い。
なお、steam版は翻訳料金がかかっているので若干高い。DLsiteでは650円で販売している。

[h1]ページめくり[/h1]
よくある恋愛シミュレーションは画面下に2,3行のテキストだが、こちらは画面全体に最大15行ほどのテキスト。ひぐらしみたいに。
1画面表示するのに複数のウェイトが置かれていたりする。ひぐらしみたいに。初期のひぐらしのように1ページ一括表示は可能。
ウェイトに立ち絵・背景変化があり、アニメーション中は1秒ぐらいテキストが消える。ひぐらしみたいに。このアニメーションの速度調整は無いため、一括表示にしていても描画されるまで待たされる。ひぐらしみたいに。


[h1]背景[/h1]
ポスタライズされた写真が多く使われている。ひぐらしみたいに。
1枚絵がつかわれることがある。こちらはひぐらしではない。


[h1]操作[/h1]
[list]
 [*]Returnでページめくり(クリック))
 [*]Rでバックログ
 [*]Escapeでメニュー(右クリック)
 [*]Aでオートモード 
 [*]Return長押しで押している間はスキップモード
[/list]
他にもあるかもしれないが気づいたのはこれだけ。
Return長押しが面倒な場合は、描画を最速にしてオートモードで代用できる。スキップよりは遅い。

[h1]その他[/h1]
話をすすめるとTipsが追加されていく。ひぐらしみたいに。
ひぐらしとは違い、Chapterを指定して読み進めることが出来る。
ひぐらしとは違い、Galleryモードがあるので見たい絵をいつでも表示可能。

author: {'steamid': '76561198078842756', 'num_games_owned': 2149, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1859, 'last_played': 1516465621}
review:
落ち着いた雰囲気のサウンドノベル。
プレイ時間は1周20時間～25時間ほど。選択肢なし。
全体的に実生活的なシーンを中心としており、
序盤はミステリー的な部分はかなりスローテンポだが、
中盤以降は読者に疑問、興味を持たせる場面が増えてゆき、
終盤で大きな謎は答えが出される（ストアページや公式HPの紹介文にネタバレが）。
ミステリー部分の謎が解けていくに連れ、
それぞれの世界のあり方、人物たちの心のあり方が語られる。

百合としては萌え的な掛け合いは(すく)ないものの、
世界観、死生観が物語を読み進めていく間に2人を魅力的な百合カップルにしている。
百合となってはいるが、この2人は女性でなくても魅力的なカップルになったと思う（ホモ並感）。

システム面での細かい不満点は
セーブが5箇所しかなく（チャプターセレクトがあるものの）、読み返す際に若干不便だった（それだけ伏線が多い）点と
誤字脱字が多い点が挙げられる。


特にsteam実績やトレカなどにこだわりがなければDLsiteでの購入を推奨（648円）

author: {'steamid': '76561198004823065', 'num_games_owned': 572, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 4442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1906, 'last_played': 1531703545}
review:
[strike] サンプル画像で女の子同士がキスしとるじゃろ？[/strike]
[strike] それだけでマストバイなのじゃ[/strike]

百合ノベルゲーです。ゆっくり読んで20時間ほど。
ボイスなし、選択肢なし
途中で百合に割り込んでくるクソ男なし
意味もなく邪魔してくる性悪女なし。
そこらへんは安心してください。

ただし「百合ミステリー」というジャンルになっているため多少人を選びます。
ミステリーらしく不思議なことが起こりますが
前述のとおり選択肢はないので自分で謎を解く必要がないのです。
勝手に謎が起こって勝手に進んでいくので何も考えないで進めると謎が謎のままでおわります。
事実俺はまだ１周しただけですが結構謎が残っています。
謎を解明しつつもう１周するつもりです。
百合のｷｬｯｷｬｳﾌﾌだけを求めている人には向かないかもしれません。

あと日常パートが結構長く単調で眠くなるかもしれません
（３～４章あたりですごく眠たくなりました・・）
それでも後半になるにつれて
「まだ終わりたくないこの世界に浸っていたいな・・」となっていたので
終わってみればとても良い作品だったと思います。人は選びますがお勧めしたいです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198001149625', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1250, 'last_played': 1535883880}
review:
SeaBed est une visual novel qui parle de voyages, de souvenirs, de nourriture, de rêves et de la séparation entre deux jeunes femmes (pas forcément dans cet ordre). Pour sa version accessible aux gens normaux Fruitbat Factory a fait un bon travail en permettant au lecteur d'augmenter la résolution jusqu'en 1440*1080 (le futur!) Vous pourrez alors apprécier des arrières plans un peu cheap ainsi que des sprites et des CG plutôt réussis malgré quelques grossières erreurs de proportions. La musique est bien adaptée, les sons sont au dessus de la moyenne du genre et l'absence de voice acting ne se fait jamais ressentir.

La ou le titre brille, c'est dans sa façon d'être raconté. En changeant régulièrement de point de vue, SeaBed suit le cheminement de trois personnages aux personnalités différentes mais au but commun, comprendre ce qui a pu causer la séparation entre deux d'entre eux et peut être réparer ce lien brisé. Les dialogues font naturels, les descriptions sont nombreuses et tombent justes. D'une manière générale le texte fourmille de petits détails sur l'environnement, la faune et la flore qui rendent les scènes intéressantes et vivantes.

Le rythme est globalement lent, les personnages ne sont pas pressés ou en danger, il n'y a donc pas vraiment « d'action » ni de suspens haletant. L'histoire suit tranquillement son cours en donnant de temps à autre des indices, des questions encore sans réponses, des passages touchants et quelques moments de légèreté. Les scènes importantes se mélangent avec des tranches de vie et si l'on ajoute les « tips » secondaires débloqués au cours de la lecture, il peut y avoir quelques confusions et besoin de relire. Heureusement le titre est généreusement découpé en chapitre et tout est facilement accessible via menu.

Pendant les 20-30h nécessaires à la lecture, SeaBed fait travailler les méninges et réussit à maintenir très convenablement le doute quant à un dénouement que j'ai trouvé logique et satisfaisant.
Si vous aimez le mystère, un peu de psychologie, les jolies filles et bien évidemment la nourriture, je ne saurais que vous conseiller d'au moins vous essayer à la démo.

Qu'est ce que vous attendez? [i]« You're planning to sleep in the dream? »[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561197963989951', 'num_games_owned': 622, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1057, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1057, 'last_played': 1515461365}
review:
I've never read anything like this.

Seabed is a VN that ends up feeling like a dream. It's hard to tell what is real or not because a lot of things don't really make sense, and it's hard to make sense of it even when everything ends. Every chapter has an insane amount of descriptive detail, and the story has a comforting repetition to it. Some segments can be frustratingly longwinded, but at its best it's like wrapping yourself in a warm blanket on a cold morning.

I don't recommend this VN to everyone, but if you can handle not much happening and all of the meticulous detail I would say give it a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024950494', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 873, 'last_played': 1527218979}
review: It's hard to describe this game without spoiling it.  It's best read when you have no idea what it's about.  It's slow, descriptive, and told in a roundabout way that will have you asking questions the whole way while trying to cling onto some hope for a happy ending that seemingly already failed to come.  It's hardly even a yuri novel if you've read ones in the past, as there's very little falling in love or big arcs characters go through.  Rather, it's about reflecting on the happy past and trying to move on in a world where that happiness is gone.  Very emotional story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044563176', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 1119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 914, 'last_played': 1537712987}
review:
While not as riveting as it wants to be nor as emotionally-lasting as it tries to be, there are more good qualities than bad to be found at the bottom of SeaBed's complex labyrinth of perspective and companionship. Fighting off the urge to sleep, a struggle shared by our main protagonists, is a genuine threat for those not fully motivated by a slow-going and intricately-devised narrative structure. Fortunately, the emphasis of its craft supported by a great soundtrack and a wide variety of semi-interesting characters makes for a fulfilling and memorable experience when all is said and done. The only sacrifice made should be one's heightened expectations upon discovery; the answer feels as bittersweet as the debut screen.

+ Great soundtrack
+ Heaps of detail for psychological enthusiasts
+ Foreshadowing 101

- Dry dialogue
- Payoff doesn't match the build-up
- Main couple has little chemistry

Read the full review at https://www.keengamer.com/article/17623_seabed-review

author: {'steamid': '76561198036537305', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1514411567}
review:
Seabed is compelling, despite it's flaws. I won't bother going over the synopsys, you can read that in the page description. It's best to go into this game completely blind anyway.

It's romance and slice of life made me happy and sad at the same time, it's mystery kept me guessing and hoping. It's presentation is great in a lot of aspects, good visuals and an amazing OST that I will continue listening to from time to time.

Anyone interested in a compelling and interesting novel that you won't be able to stop reading, please give this game a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063797315', 'num_games_owned': 527, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 622, 'last_played': 1514162479}
review:
Поиграл.
Не сказал бы, что эта история мне прямо зашла, но какой-то интерес в ней все таки есть. Хоть тут и есть пару фансервисных сцен, которые можно истолковать как отношение между нашими героинями, но это далеко не так. Если углубиться в эту историю, то станет понятно, что они пытаются понять смысл всех странных событий с которыми они сталкиваются в своей жизни. 
Единственное что мне не понравилось (именно лично мне) так это большинство фонов. Не именно сами фоны, а то как они изображены в этой новелле. В основном это реальные фотографии с применением тако эффекта, будто их нарисовали от руки. Но может кому-то такое и нравится.
Ещё одна вещь которую я не могу не отметить, так это множество звуковых эффектов, которые напротяженнии всей истории сопровождают нас в различных сценах.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972507694', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1822, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1023, 'last_played': 1571133670}
review:
Disclaimer: I'm not at the end yet, will update this review once I finish the story!

I'm having a fantastic time after about 8 hours of gameplay, there's a lot of subtext in every scene to tread through and I'm seeing a lot of foreshadowing for the future that I'm very much excited for. The characters are all fun and interesting (shoutout to bestgirl Narasaki) the music is good, the animation is admittedly low quality but the developers clearly had fun experimenting with '2D stop motion'. If you're looking for a cute story, this is for you. if you're looking for a mystery, this probably is for you too! I'm looking forward to seeing the payoff and reading through this again with more knowledge~

author: {'steamid': '76561198062394411', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1546895084}

author: {'steamid': '76561198300558746', 'num_games_owned': 384, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1817, 'last_played': 1513703555}
review:
[h1] Introduction  [/h1] 
A Yuri-themed kinetic novel told through the perspectives of three separate characters Which took me around 30 hours to finish reading. The game itself is set up like a book with a wall of text that starts from the top then moves down as you read occasionally fading out to show you when a picture in the background has changed facial expressions. 
The story itself can get kinda confusing because not only does it change perspective between three separate characters it also jumps between the past, present and Sachiko's hallucinations. 
As for the changing perspectives you don't have to worry about not knowing who you are. On the side of the screen, there is a conveniently placed nameplate stating whos perspective you are looking through at the moment and changes when you change to a new character.
 
[h1] Story [/h1] 
The Story is very Psychological diving deep inside a character's head and occasionally will go on long explanations about things that will make you question what is real and what is not and not just within the story of the game but within the reality you yourself live in and there were multiple times were I just stopped reading to think about what I just read, Which is were this game really shines and that is in the amazing writing of the story and its character. 
I personally found every character Likable especially the 3 point of view  characters who are:

Sachiko - the person you will be spending the most time as is suffering from hallucinations she sees her childhood friend/lover Takako who for some reason is no longer in her life and she cant remember why.

Takako - Sachiko's childhood friend/lover seems to have a similar condition and has moments were ringing in her ears causes her to lose parts of her memory and she also can't remember why Sachiko is no longer in her life.

Nagasaki is a psychiatrist who wants to help Sachiko out and uncover way she is having hallucinations and it's also her character that delves into the more Psychological explanations that get you thinking.

[h1] Graphics [/h1] 
The backgrounds are filtered photographs while I was not a big fan of them I did like that there were a lot of different ones and I mean a lot from multiple points of view and shown in different times of the day so I never had to stare at the same background for very long. They also had a large variety from Western housing, to Japan, to a town in Italy even the Golden Gate Bridge.
Characters sprites are nice, almost every character has a sprite even if they are only shown for one scene and the main ones have multiple sprites with different poses, facial expressions and outfits. There is also a lot of CG in the gallery. I counted 93 and almost all those pictures have different alternates with different faces or some kind of movement. As for the art style, I found it simple there was nothing completely original about it but it was nice to look at.

[h1] Audio [/h1] 
I really liked the sound effects, which helps you get the feel of what's going on and adds to the atmosphere like water running, stove cooking, eggs breaking, book pages turning. Though none of the music really stood out except for the creepy music box sounding one that only seemed to appear in the tips section called Narasaki's clinic.

[h1] Closing Thoughts [/h1] 
I can say without a doubt I recommend it. Yuri was the main reason I was interested in this game. However, just because I love yuri, doesn't mean that's all I want in a story, and this game did not disappoint me. Yes, there is a yuri love story, but there is so much more too, well-written characters, mystery, and intrigue and psychological wonders.
